claims.subject: Dennis
claims.claim: Claims to have seen the suspect multiple times in different locations.
claims.quote: I've seen him on many occasions in Springfield.
claims.context: Dennis expresses that he has been seeing the same suspect repeatedly.

claims.subject: Dennis
claims.claim: Claims he delivered marijuana to Amanda on the day of her murder.
claims.quote: The day of manager's kill, I went and bought her some weed.
claims.context: Dennis recounts delivering weed to Amanda on the morning of her death.

claims.subject: Dennis
claims.claim: Claims he overheard a conversation implying a drug deal went wrong.
claims.quote: I heard something about money and drugs.
claims.context: Dennis describes hearing an argument regarding money while at Amanda's.

claims.subject: Crystal
claims.claim: Crystal physically assaulted the speaker.
claims.quote: she hit me with a bat on my head.
claims.context: The speaker recounts a past incident of domestic violence.

claims.subject: Amanda
claims.claim: Amanda was killed shortly after a drug deal.
claims.quote: the day that Amanda was killed, I went and bought her some weed.
claims.context: The speaker provides details surrounding the time before Amanda's death.

claims.subject: the guy
claims.claim: The guy who opened Amanda's back door was suspicious.
claims.quote: The guy looked suspicious as hell.
claims.context: The speaker describes his interaction with a man before Amanda's murder.

claims.subject: the speaker
claims.claim: The speaker has been fearful for his life since Amanda's death.
claims.quote: I have been terrified for my life.
claims.context: The speaker indicates ongoing fear connected to witnessing events related to Amanda's murder.

claims.subject: Investigation report
claims.claim: Details of the investigation into the fatal stabbing
claims.quote: Massachusetts State Police Crime Scene Services Section Report of Investigation
claims.context: This report outlines the findings of the investigation into the fatal stabbing.

claims.subject: Trooper Ronald Gibbons
claims.claim: Responded to homicide
claims.quote: I responded to a homicide at 73 School St. (Apartment 3R) in the City of Chicopee.
claims.context: Trooper Gibbons documented the crime scene during the investigation.

claims.subject: Investigation findings
claims.claim: Victim's body had numerous injuries consistent with an edged weapon
claims.quote: I observed reddish-brown stains consistent with blood on the victim’s body and throughout the kitchen area. The victim’s body had numerous injuries consistent with an edged weapon.
claims.context: This description helps establish the nature of the crime.

claims.subject: Friction ridge impressions
claims.claim: Impressions matched Seth Green's fingerprints
claims.quote: it was determined that friction ridge impression 2-9 was individualized to the #8 left middle finger of Seth Green.
claims.context: Fingerprint analysis indicated a match to one of the suspects.

claims.subject: Dennis Rosa Roman
claims.claim: He is not the murderer and claims he is the wrongfully accused.
quote: You guys have the right guy. No, you guys have the wrong guy.
claims.context: Dennis asserts that he is being wrongfully accused and identifies himself while expressing frustration.

claims.subject: Dennis Rosa Roman
claims.claim: He feels suicidal in his current situation.
quote: Yeah, I am suicidal actually. I am.
claims.context: Dennis admits to feeling suicidal during the interaction with law enforcement.

claims.subject: Dennis Rosa Roman
claims.claim: He was involved in an altercation where he tried to save someone.
claims.context: Dennis presents an account of an incident related to Amanda Plosh's death.

Dennis recalls meeting Amanda for the first time and providing marijuana.
Dennis overheard a dispute upon delivering marijuana related to payment.
The speaker witnessed Amanda being killed.
The speaker provided his statement to the police.
The speaker was involved in a physical altercation with Crystal.
Evidence processed for friction ridge impressions
Report prepared by Trooper Todd R. Girouard
Dennis was taken into custody and involved in a booking process.
Dennis was hit by a car at age 16.

key_facts.fact: Dennis has been with Eric and Gary since day one.
Amanda was killed around the time Dennis delivered marijuana to her.
Dennis has seen the suspect in multiple locations after Amanda's death.
Dennis has no formal identification or a lawyer and expressed fear for his safety.
The speaker's ex-girlfriend Crystal stabbed him with a butter knife during an altercation.
Amanda was killed shortly after asking the speaker for weed.
The speaker was present during multiple violent events involving Crystal and Amanda.
The speaker had a friend Isaiah who witnessed part of the events.
The police were involved in the investigation and took a statement from the speaker.
Investigation involved multiple officers from the Massachusetts State Police.
Victim Amanda Lynn Plasse was found at 73 School St., Chicopee.
Numerous suspects were identified including Seth Green and Jessie M. Coulombe.
Dennis Rosa Roman was trying to contact his girlfriend.
He expresses distress about his situation and says he feels suicidal.
He claims to have been wrongfully accused of murder.
His mother’s name is Dorcas Ortiz.
He mentions a baby thermometer worth 15 bucks.
